rev.comment: rv Read the talk page, this has been discussed for the past 1-2 weeks
rv Read the talk page, this has been discussed for the past 1-2 weeks.
Revert to revision 82347364 dated 2006-10-19 02:47:15 by 24.29.137.239 using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
changed to African American (father was African; mother was American; this is his self-identification)
rv; "...with known ancestors from [[sub-Saharan Africa]]" was my edit, not Shakam's -- comments here please: [[Talk:Barack Obama#Request for Comment: Barack Obama's self-identification]]
/* Early life and career */ added [[African]] and [[United States citizen|American]]
/* Trivia */ Removed; not trivia, and covered in /* Early life and career */ section
/* Early life and career */ added quotations from [[Dreams from My Father]] for Obama's own skin color descriptions of his mother and father
Another try at finding language agreeable to all; please remember that the focus of this article is intended to be Obama's [[biography]], not his [[biology]]
/* Early life and career */ section rewrite
AA doesn't necessarily equal biracial, but if someone is AA AND Biracial, that implies that being biracial is a subset of the African American identity: Superfluous.
POV should not be taken. African-American does not equal to White/Black Biracial; thus, not redundant.
African Americans are a mixed people. Redundent.
changed ethnical label to not mislead
Added back edits that were removed without a reason
/* Presidential ambitions */ "'Speaks so well' is something you say about retarded people that can talk" - paraphrasing [[Chris Rock]]
Re-inserted text that was deleted for no stated reason
/* Keynote address */ removed misquote (deleted line was spoken before first line of blockquote text)
/* Political advocacy */ Replaced with more relevant quote
chances are ther are at least a couple white senators that have relatively recent african ancestors
changed instances of "TIME Magazine" to "TIME magazine"
/* Other legislative issues */ changed to /* Other legislative action */; please review [[WP:BLP]]
agree with HailFire that this is barely relevant to Obama; it belongs in the IL Senate 2004 article
/* Presidential ambitions */ added text, image, and reference on TIME Magazine cover story
/* Further reading */ added TIME cover story
/* Senate campaign */ excessive detail for this summary; please create an article on Rezko for this, or fit it into main article [[Illinois United States Senate election, 2004]]
Rezko is not a random guy; he is a major Democratic fundraiser, and under Federal Investigation
the first thing in the subsection isn't discussing Obama's candidacy, it's discussing some random guy who gave Obama money? no.
Added Tony Rezko support for Obama Senatorial Campaign
/* Self-Identification Controversy */ As the orginal editor of this section, I ask that the debate '''now''' be taken it to [[WP:RFC]] -- an edit war serves only to disrupt the article
please explain why this is a notable controversy on the talk page
Obviously it has since it has been cited from a newspaper (the New York Times). A newspaper is a form of media.
This is a manufactured controversy-are there a few sources for this?-did this receive media attention? Please argue for inclusion...thanks
Yes it is, it is cited.
/* Controversy */ -This is a manufactured controversy-are there a few sources for this?-did this receive media attention? Is this notable?
not a real controversy....is there more than one article about this...this is more a problem with the term african american than with obama
/* Controversy */ Replace weasel word "some" with a specific person's name
rv give a reason for deletion
/* Early life and career */ removed "later"; he began both law firm and teaching in 1993; see cite -- thanks for editing
for the last time, he identifies himself as african-american
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/71.250.238.227|71.250.238.227]] to last version by 128.135.102.43
/* Legislation */ edited caption... I think [[User:Jbpo]] is trying to make a [[WP:POINT]]
Added link to Coburn Ammendment. Obama compromised with Ted Stevens to fund Bridge to Nowhere.
/* Russia and Eastern Europe */ reduced image 50 pixels
/* Legislation */ Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 signed into law
shall we go through his entire senate voting record and explain each vote here? at least provide a newspaper article saying why that was important . . .
What is the coburn amendment....needs source
Added congressional record source for Obama support for Bridge to Nowhere
/* Senate campaign */ condensed section; added missing references
rv he self-identifies as an african american
rv Obama supports the "Bridge to Nowhere"
Added reference to NY Magazine article
/* Keynote address */ wikilinked [[Flag of the United States|stars and stripes]]
"African American" is his self-identification: See [[WP:MoS#Identity]] and [African_american#_note-14]]; if disagreed, kindly resume discussion here [[Talk:Barack_Obama#First_of...]], thanks
resubmitting Braun and Brooke under trivia
/* Russia and Eastern Europe */ added image
/* Senate career */ dabs [[United States Secretary of State]]
rv - seems an unnecessary detail for the intro of this article, as the subject is Obama, not African-Americans in the Senate

no citation needed - very well known fact
put it back, article is from June 2006
